socorro_links.comment_text:
Crash report: https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/report/index/17654926-fdef-4231-b509-6ee790251005



Reason: ```EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ```


Top 10 frames of crashing thread:
```
0  igd12um64kbl.dll  <unknown in igd12um64kbl.dll>  
1  igd12um64kbl.dll  <unknown in igd12um64kbl.dll>  
2  igd12um64kbl.dll  <unknown in igd12um64kbl.dll>  
3  D3D12Core.dll  CDevice::VersionedCreateCommandSignature  
4  D3D12Core.dll  CCommandSignature::FinalConstruct  
5  D3D12Core.dll  CLayeredObject<CCommandSignature>::CreateInstance  
6  D3D12Core.dll  CDevice::CreateLayeredChild  
7  D3D12Core.dll  CBridgeImpl<ID3D12LayeredDevice, ID3D12LayeredDevice, CLayeredObject<NDXGI::CDevice> >::CreateLayeredChild  
8  D3D12.dll  NOutermost::CDevice::CreateLayeredChild  
9  D3D12Core.dll  CDevice::CreateCommandSignature  
```



By querying Nightly crashes reported within the last 2 months, here are some insights about the signature:

- **First crash report:** 2025-10-05
- **Process type:** GPU
- **Is startup crash:** No
- **Has user comments:** No
- **Is null crash:** Yes - all crashes happened on null or near null memory address






By analyzing the backtrace, the regression may have been introduced by a patch [1] to fix Bug 1990641.

[1] https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/rev?node=1c042e689b9c



:sergesanspaille, since you are the author of the potential regressor, could you please take a look?
